page.title: 16ROMSEY'S WET FISH SHOP
page.content: On Friday 7th June 1985 Romsey's only wet fish shop closed after 22 years. We thought it was a great shame! It closed because the lease ran out and the new rent was too high. Mr Whale told us about his many happy years working there. In 1963 he found Romsey to be a quiet and friendly little market town. Then, there was no Waitrose or bus station. The buses stopped in the Market Square and there was a two way traffic system. There was a market down Bell Street which sold rabbits, pheasants, poultry and vegetables. Among his many regular customers were two who both came every day (except Sundays) for 22 years. Fresh cod, herrings and smoked haddock were most popular, but also salmon when in season. Mr Whale hopes to get another job in the fish trade soon.
